required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Low-level Laser Therapy (808nm) to Muscle Fatigue Resistance
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Low-level Laser Therapy (808nm) to Muscle Fatigue Resistance: a Randomized Double-blind Crossover Trial

collaborator.agency: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

brief_summary.textblock: The study hypothesis is a improved muscle fatigue resistance induced by low-level laser therapy applied between sets of intense exercises.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of maximum repetitions of knee flexion-extension in isokinetic dynamometer. Volunteers were assessed on Monday (pre evaluation - baseline), on Wednesday performed a session of exercises and on Friday were assessed again (final evaluation).

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of median frequency by surface electromyography of quadriceps femoris muscles during maximum repetitions of knee flexion-extension in isokinetic dynamometer. Volunteers were assessed on Monday (pre evaluation - baseline), on Wednesday performed a session of exercises and on Friday were assessed again (final evaluation).

arm_group.description: Use of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) to induce a muscle fatigue resistance in intense exercises
Use of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) placebo to induce a muscle fatigue resistance

intervention.description: Use of low-level laser therapy(LLLT)or placebo-LLLT applied on quadriceps femoris muscles between sets of isokinetic knee flexion-extension exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy males
- physically active
- aged between 18-28 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- smoker
- under medicine
- lower limb lesions limiting the flexion-extension of the knee joint

overall_official.last_name: Wouber Hérickson de Brito Vieira, PhD
overall_official.affiliation: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

facility.name: Federal Univesity of Rio Grande do Norte

link.description: Research Ethics Committee of the Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte

Epub 2013 Sep 5.
